page.title: 12SCHOOLS (BUTTERWICK)
page.content: The school at Butterwick was opened on 13th.July 1973 at 2.30p.m.. The headmaster was Mr.G.H.Greenfield. Two years later he was succeeded by the present head Mr. D. Laver. Before this the local children went to three schools, in Bennington, Freiston and Butterwick. The old school in Butterwick was built in 1666. In 1887 it became the girls school and is now a Youth Club. A boys school was built, where the present school now stands, in 1887. There are now 4 junior and 3 infant classes, with 225 children. Many travel in buses coming from North Sea Camp, Bennington and Long Hedges. Some children have been on a four day outing to Scarborough this year and each class has local outings at least once a year.
